page.title: 06Longton Road and Golf Course
page.content: Longton Road has old cottages in between more recent houses.Most cottages belonged to the Trentham Gardens estate for workers.Many are now privately owned with a conservation order on them.West View cottage by Ash Green roundabout was the bakery and still has evidence of an oven in an out building.Ivy Cottage used to be a farmhouse.Ivy House next door is where Edward VII used to visit with the Duke of Sutherland for refreshment before going to play golf.No.58 is designated as a Police House,in residential use,with a substation open at certain times.The terraced row of cottages,the Paddocks,used to be stables for the Priory.Trentham Golf Club came into being in 1895 for the Duchess of Sutherland and her lady friends.In 1901 it was opened to gents.The present club house,built in 1903,now has 730members.
